news.title: Mohali: Illegal buildings around Sukhna lake pulled down
news.para: Mohali district administration conducted an anti-encroachment drive in Naya Gaon, targeting unauthorized constructions in the Kansal catchment area of Sukhna Lake. The operation, in compliance with high court directions, focused on structures violating court orders and land use norms, some of which obstructed natural drainage channels.

news.title: Mysuru development body proposes expanding local planning area, but doubts linger
news.para: Mysuru Development Authority proposes to nearly double its local planning area to 1,200 sq km for organized growth. However, concerns persist about the lack of integrated mass transport planning and potential confusion with recent city limit expansions. Urban planners warn of connectivity issues without prioritizing transport infrastructure alongside land use.

news.title: Lucknow: EOW arrests Shine City’s HR officer
news.para: The economic offences wing (EOW) has arrested Preeti Singh, an HR officer and authorized signatory for Shine City Group, in connection with a multi-crore real estate scam. Singh allegedly played a key role in executing fraudulent transactions by signing buyer agreements for Shine City Infra Project Pvt Ltd, which promised land allotment and high returns but failed to deliver.

news.title: Bengaluru development body to educate public on illegal layouts
news.para: The Bangalore Development Authority (BDA) is issuing public notices to educate citizens about lawful construction practices after identifying 258 unauthorized layouts. These notices aim to warn buyers against investing in properties without proper approvals, as many are built on agricultural land and risk demolition. Activists, however, caution that government amnesty for converting B-khata to A-khata may legitimize poorly planned layouts.

news.title: Noida techie death: No bail, MZ Wiztown Planners' director moves high court
news.para: A chief judicial magistrate court denied bail to Abhay Kumar, a director of MZ Wiztown Planners, arrested in connection with a software engineer's death. Kumar's lawyers have filed a habeas corpus petition in the Allahabad high court, alleging illegal arrest and violation of constitutional rights. The court extended Kumar's judicial remand by 10 days.

news.title: Odisha RERA to make exposure visits, hold weekly meets to ensure timely project registrations
news.para: Odisha Real Estate Regulatory Authority (ORERA) will visit Chhattisgarh, Andhra Pradesh, and Telangana to learn best practices for timely realty project registration. This initiative follows criticism for significant delays in issuing certificates, with some taking over 100 days instead of the mandated 30. ORERA also plans weekly meetings and technical website improvements to expedite the process.

news.title: SC seeks reply of Maharashtra govt, civic body on plea against HC order on slum rehabilitation
news.para: The Supreme Court is scrutinizing a Bombay High Court ruling that green-lights slum rehabilitation on land designated for parks and recreational areas. Critics contend that this encroachment jeopardizes Mumbai's precious open spaces. The High Court previously endorsed a regulation allowing such projects, provided a portion of the land is reinstated for public access.

news.title: London's luxury One Hyde Park wins UK lawsuit over $48 million repair bill
news.para: After a lengthy legal battle, One Hyde Park, a premier luxury apartment complex in London, has emerged victorious in its lawsuit against a British construction company. The court's ruling compels the firm to pay in excess of 35 million pounds due to their negligence in pipework repairs that were inadequately executed.

news.title: Delhi civic body extends property tax amnesty scheme SUNIYO till February 28
news.para: The Municipal Corporation of Delhi has extended its property tax amnesty scheme SUNIYO until February 28, 2026. Property owners can clear long-pending dues without penalties or interest. This offers a chance to regularize tax records.

news.title: Brookfield Asset Management to buy Peakstone Realty for $1.2 billion
news.para: Brookfield Asset Management plans to acquire Peakstone Realty Trust for around $1.2 billion, a strategic effort to expand its industrial real estate holdings focused on warehouses and outdoor storage.

news.title: Akzo Nobel India net profit dips 31.58% in Q3 FY26, to be renamed JSW Dulux
news.para: Akzo Nobel India saw its net profit drop by over 31% in the quarter ending December 31, 2025. JSW Paints completed the acquisition of a majority stake in the company on December 10, 2025. Following this, the company's board approved a name change to JSW Dulux.

news.title: Awfis Space Solutions' net profit up 42.72% in Q3 FY26
news.para: Awfis Space Solutions' net consolidated profit surged by 42.72 percent in the quarter ending December 31, 2025. Total income also saw a significant rise. The companyexpanded its network by adding ten new centers.

news.title: MHADA to sell 120 unsold flats in Mumbai on first-come-first-served basis from February 5
news.para: Mumbai Housing and Area Development Board, MHADA, will sell 120 unsold residential flats.  These units are available on a first-come-first-served basis. Online registrations open on February 5, 2026.  Flat selection and payment processes begin February 12, 2026.

news.title: Nexus Select Trust declares ₹359 crore distribution to unitholders for Q3 FY26
news.para: Nexus Select Trust will distribute Rs 358.60 crore to its unitholders for the quarter ending December 2025. The real estate investment trust reported a consolidated net profit of Rs 139.40 crore for the October-December period. Total income also rose to Rs 691.93 crore.

news.title: SC upholds insolvency proceedings against real estate firms for Greater Noida project
news.para: The Supreme Court has affirmed the initiation of insolvency proceedings against Bhasin Infotech and Grand Venezia. This ruling stands as a firm defense of the rights of both homebuyers and commercial investors, highlighting the developers' failure to deliver promised functional units and their misleading communications.

news.title: Bajaj Housing Finance's net profit rises 21.10% in Q3 FY26
news.para: Bajaj Housing Finance announced a significant 21.10 percent jump in its net profit for the quarter ending December 31, 2025. The company's profit after tax reached ₹664.89 crore. Total income also saw a healthy rise of 17.85 percent.

news.title: Mahindra Lifespace Developers posts net profit of ₹108.88 crore in Q3 FY26
news.para: Mahindra Lifespace Developers has announced strong financial results for the quarter ending December 31, 2025. The company reported a net profit of ₹108.88 crore, a turnaround from a loss in the previous year. Total income also saw a substantial increase of over 150 percent.

news.title: Secunderabad Cantonment residents submit ward-wise house tax arrears recovery proposal
news.para: Residents of Ward-8, Secunderabad Cantonment, have proposed a ward-wise tax arrears recovery plan to authorities. The initiative calls for stricter, legally structured enforcement of overdue house tax collections under the Cantonments Act 2006, including fortnightly drives and escalation against chronic defaulters.

news.title: Pune civic body proposes 10% hike in property tax, citizens’ groups question move
news.para: Pune Municipal Corporation proposes a 10% property tax hike to boost revenue, facing opposition from citizens' groups who urge recovery of Rs 7,000 crore in dues from defaulters. Officials cite limited revenue options post-Octroi abolition and highlight recent amnesty scheme success in recovering Rs 713 crore.

news.title: Haryana affordable housing scheme stalled in NCR cities amid rising land, construction costs
news.para: Affordable housing initiatives in Gurugram and Faridabad are currently at a standstill. The surging costs associated with land and construction have made existing price structures impractical for developers to comply with. Meanwhile, residents eagerly anticipate new housing alternatives.
